cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi (40 km) NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and about 105 mi (170 km) E of West Palm Beach, Florida

motion.direction: WNW (nearly stationary, expected to resume slow WNW then turn NW and NE)

cyclone.trajectory: Projected to edge slowly northwest tonight and Tuesday, then turn north-northwest and finally northeast Wednesday–Friday while paralleling the Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Very near the South Carolina / southern North Carolina coast (close pass near Cape Fear – Wilmington area) – a direct landfall is still uncertain

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet north of South Santee River SC – additional hurricane or tropical-storm watches likely for the North Carolina coast later Tuesday
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings currently extend only up to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; none yet for the Carolinas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas, including Cape Fear and the lower Cape Lookout area
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (forecast 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches along Coastal Carolinas)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (NHC guidance suggests 4–7 ft possible just south of Cape Fear; 3–5 ft a reasonable estimate for Wilmington reach)
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (73%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; up to 38% chance of sustained 50-kt winds and 11% chance of hurricane-force gusts as the eye stays offshore Thursday-Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 3–5 ft above ground possible near the Cape Fear River mouth if the center passes just offshore, with large battering waves
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches, local 15 inches, producing flash-flood potential in the lower Cape Fear basin
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents already occurring; isolated tornadoes possible in coastal rainbands as the cyclone moves northward
